J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>The most common real-life scenario for me has to do with refactoring legacy code. I need tests before I can refactor. If a component is not designed to be tested, then I may need to reach into its bowels to write the tests I need to start refactoring.
>
>I don't have a real-life example at hand, though.
>

Hard to say without an example, but in such a case, I would simply 
change the visibility of the method from private to package (in java).
As I put the tests in the same package, but in another source tree, that 
would do the trick.

Should I have to make its "unpublished" quality more obvious, I'd add a 
big red (html)  "FOR TEST ONLY - DON'T USE" in the javadoc of the method.

Alain
